fullText: Bradley Cooper brings his movie-star magnetism to bear on the grotesquely deformed title character in this powerful revival of Bernard Pomerance's 1979 drama.

bwwExcerpt: As Treves dispassionately drones on about his subject's twisted limbs and misshapen torso, Cooper stands stock still in a cone of light and silently contorts his own perfect body into an approximation of each deformity. The piece de r√©sistance is his depiction of the 'wide slobbering aperture' that is Merrick's mouth. Shaping his own mouth into a fleshy oval, the thesp gives expressive voice to the sensitive and intelligent human being imprisoned in his own body. It's a stunning performance, deeply felt and very moving.
